cards.back: Abstraction in CS means to ignore unnecessary details
Decomposition means breaking a problem down into smaller chunks that are more easily solved.
a series of instructions that combine to solve a problem.

cards.front: Which algorithm is usually more efficient? Binary search or linear search?
What is the precondition that must be true before we can use a binary search?
Which sort algorithm makes repeated passes of the data set and guarantees to move one item at a time to the end of the data set?

cards.back: Tiny areas of extremely fast memory located in the CPU normally designed for a specific purpose, where data or control information is stored temporarily.

cards.front: What is reCaptcha and where is it used?
cards.back: reCaptcha is a method of user authentication where a website tries to ensure the user is human
A notation used in Boolean algebra for defining the output of a logic gate or logic circuit for all possible combinations of inputs.

cards.front: What is the role of an interpretter?
cards.back: It translates a high level language such as Python, C++ etc. into machine code (binary) one line at a time at run time (when the code is executed)

cards.front: What is the role of a compiler?
cards.back: It translates a high level language such as Python, C++ etc. into machine code (binary) all at once. It produces compiled code which executes very quickly.

cards.front: What are weakly typed programming languages?
cards.back: Languages that will try to convert data types to avoid errors, however this can lead to unpredictable errors

cards.front: What are strongly typed programming languages?
cards.back: Languages that won't try to convert data types and so will produce more errors but more predictable results
